title: Address comparison condition in modifier is resolving improperly
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (6672134 2023-08-08T00:21:00.190027227Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test -vvvvv --match-test testProtectableTokenFreezeAddsFrozenAddress

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

I am trying to run a test I wrote called `testProtectableTokenFreezeAddsFrozenAddress` which attempts to call a function gated by a modifier that checks `msg.sender` against an address variable called `assetProtectionRole`, and if they don't match it reverts. Simple access gating. In my test called `testProtectableTokenAssetProtectionRoleSet`, I set `assetProtectionRole` and verify that it matches `msg.sender`, however when the modifier comparing these two is engaged when calling a function that utilizes it, the very same condition a previous test is verifying appears to exhibit the opposite behavior. I've used `console2.log()` to dig deeper and have confirmed `msg.sender == assetProtectionRole`, so why does the opposite condition appear to be true instead?

![VirtualBoxVM_4yBRlwQwSP](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/114717981/497d4143-eaa1-4aa7-8e69-a2ee8dbca76d)

The project I'm working out of is at https://github.com/Zodomo/pyusd-contract
You can replicate the behavior I'm seeing by running `forge test -vvvvv --match-test testProtectableTokenFreezeAddsFrozenAddress`
